text: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala (born 13 June 1954) is a Nigerian-American economist and international development expert. On 15 February 2021, she was appointed as Director-General of the World Trade Organization. She is the first woman and the first African to hold the office. ==References== Category:1954 births Category:Living people Category:World Trade Organization Directors-General Category:Nigerian politicians Category:American economists
title: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala
